units.title: AF cell sorting and isolation
units.text: Bottom left: the FACS plot shows the sorting markers, strategy utilized to collect the living cell fraction, negative for propidium iodide (PI) and positive for Hoechst.
units.rationale: This describes a specific, actionable cell sorting protocol using FACS with defined markers.

units.title: AFEpC culture and expansion
units.text: AFEpC culture (Extended Data Fig. 2b). AFOs showed multiple morphologies, expanded up to passage 20 and successfully cryopreserved, providing evidence of self-renewal and long-term culture (Fig. 2c,d and Extended Data Fig. 2b–e).
units.rationale: This details the culture conditions and expansion capacity of AFEpCs, a core procedural step.

units.title: Organoid formation and quantification
units.text: Organoid formation was observed in 89.7% of AF samples, with a median formation efficiency of ... d, Formed organoids per mm2 at 7–15 d of culture quantified over ten passages (n ≥ 11 organoids from n = 19 independent AF samples; median and quartiles)
units.rationale: This provides quantitative, time-defined protocol steps for organoid formation and measurement.

units.title: EdU proliferation assay
units.text:
EdU assay showing proliferating cells localized at the crypt-like structure bases (scale bar, 50 μm).
h, Functional evaluation of disaccharidase activity (n = 2 independent biological samples; n = 3 clonal organoid lines; n = 1 pediatric small intestinal ileal organoid control; mean ± s.e.m.).
units.rationale: This describes a specific assay protocol to detect proliferating cells in organoids.

units.title: Long-term KAFO culture and staining
units.text:
a, Phase-contrast images showing long-term KAFO culture (scale bar, 200 μm). Immunofluorescent staining highlights proliferative marker Ki67 (scale bar, 50 μm).
Fluid sampling to AFO characterization and expansion is implemented within 4–6 weeks, a timeline relevant to prenatal intervention.
units.rationale: This combines culture duration and immunofluorescent staining as a procedural protocol for organoid maintenance and analysis.
